content.description: The start is the crux, although the finish may give pause for thought as one leaves the final bolt to head up to the anchors. In between lovely flakes make for a fun cruise above what seems like a considerable drop due to the climb being perched above a boulder.
content.protection: Anchor bolt on ledge, three bolts bolts on the climb, chains on top.
content.location: The three-bolted line is left of Early Morning Warm Up. Traverse out onto a boulder ledge to start/belay.

climbs.name: Early Morning Warm-up
climbs.fa: (TR) Jim Hammerle, 1990 FL: Pete Paredes and Brad Singer, September 2007

content.description: A very short, but excellent route with positive edges and jugs the whole way. A steep crux at the start leads to more fun moves all the way up to the anchors. Too bad it's so short!
content.protection: Three bolts to a double bolt anchor.

climbs.name: Blue Balls
climbs.fa: Marina Amador, Nick Reynaga, Angela Hwangpo & Kenn Kenaga, August 2019

content.description:
Start direct or clip the first bolt on

Lap Dance

then move up and right passing a distinctive hole in the rock and finish on thin edges and knobs.

The anchors, like all of the others on this wall, are too far back from the lip and will thrash your rope!

Rap off instead of lowering!
content.protection: 3 bolts, chain anchors + single belay bolt at the base
content.location:
Located just right of

Lap Dance

.

content.description:
This is a short but technical thin crack up a dark section of rock. Although this has been soloed/bouldered it is often top-roped.

Mistakenly called

Afternoon Pull-Down

in the Hidden Treasures East guidebook.
content.location:
Right side of the east face and right of

Early Morning Warm-up

.
